arm_group.description: Inhaling hypoxic gas mixture to induce hypoxemia during recordings of diameter changes of retinal vessels. Recording are performed during hypoxia alone and in combination with the associated interventions at two examination days.

Breathing atmospheric air during recordings of diameter changes of retinal vessels. Recording are performed during normoxia alone and in combination with the associated interventions at two examination days.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective is to study if an inhibition of nitric oxide and/or prostaglandins
      affect the diameter changes of retinal vessels observed during hypoxia. Diameter changes are
      studied using the Dynamic Vessel Analyzer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diameter Changes of Retinal Vessels During Hypoxia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diabetes type 1 without retinopathy

          -  Retinal branch vein occlusion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cardio-vascular disease

          -  Lung disease

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Previous ocular disease other than retinal branch vein occlusion

          -  Previous treatment with medications influencing on the intraocular pressure or the
             metabolism of nitric oxide or prostaglandins

intervention.description: Administration of 1 drop voltaren 45 minutes before recordings of diameter changes of retinal vessels are initiated
Intravenous administration of L-NMMA during recordings of diameter changes of retinal vessels
Combination of interventions. Administration of an eye drop voltaren and 45 minutes later infusion with L-NMMA is started and recording of diameter changes of retinal vessels is performed

facility.name: Department of Ophthalmology, Aarhus University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Diameter Changes of Retinal Vessels During Hypoxia

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: Comparing the differences of diameter changes occuring during each of the interventions.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
